sen.e: It seems that Kagemori was on the outs with the second shogun MINAMOTO no Yoriie who succeeded to Yoritomo after his death, and in "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), there was the first appearance of article about Kagemori which described an incident that Kagemori was saved by Masako HOJO, widow of Yoritomo, when Yoriie took Kagemori's favorite concubine and tried to conducted chusatsu (kill a criminal) for Kagemori in 1199 soon after the period of Yoriie started.

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府北条氏による後年の編纂書『吾妻鏡』にこの事件が特筆されている背景には、頼家の横暴を浮き立たせると共に、頼朝・政子以来の北条氏と安達氏の結びつき、景盛の母の実家比企氏を後ろ盾とした頼家の勢力からの安達氏の離反を合理化する意図があるものと考えられる。
sen.e: As a background to the special description of this incident in "Azuma Kagami," compilation by the Hojo clan of Kamakura bakufu in later years, there seemed an intention to expose Yoriie's high-handed manner, and also to rationalize the connection between the Hojo clan and the Adachi clan since the period of Yoritomo and Masako and the Adachi clan's separation from the Yoriie's power with the backing of the Hiki clan, family home of Kagemori's mother.

sen.j: 「広博」とは幅広い人脈を持ち、全体を承知しているという意味と見られ、政子の意志を代弁する人物として認識されていた。
sen.e: Extensive knowledge' seemed to mean having a wide human network and knowing everything, and he was recognized as a person speaking for Masako's intentions.
